name: Petit Palace Santa Cruz

reviews.title: Location, Location, Location
reviews.text: Before I review the hotel, I have to mention, that our stay in Andalusia coincided with some of the worst weather this part of the world has experienced over the past 10 years. We had snow, freezing cold, rain, hail, thunderstorms, strong winds and in between a few minutes of sunshine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Santa Cruz is a prefect place from where to explore the city of Seville. Only a few steps from the Cathedral and almost every other attraction. The hotel tries to be High-Tech, but I think they tried too hard, which creates – in our opinion – a rather cold atmosphere (but then maybe it was just the weather?). The small lobby reminded us of a museum of modern art. The rooms are small, but well equipped and everything worked fine. However, what use is a nice flat screen LCD-TV with only a handful of Spanish channels plus a German, French and English News-channel of which most of them had a bad reception (a problem I encounter in almost all hotels worldwide). One big minus for this hotel is the lack of cleanliness.

reviews.title: Spot on!
reviews.text: The so called 'sanitized' Toilet was covered in some indefinable, tried stuff and the same substance could be found on the bathroom floor and the room carpet – disgusting! The breakfast room is very small and in some kind of cellar. Breakfast was ok, nothing special, just acceptable. Staff in the hotel (if they could be found) where as polite as you might expect in Spanish Tourist Spots. They do their job, nothing more, nothing less. If I recommend this Hotel, I do it for the location. That's the reason I would stay there again, its probably the best value for money and location to be found in Seville. Hasta luego

aka: Petit Palace Santa Cruz Hotel Seville
description: BOUTIQUE HOTEL IN THE HISTORIC CENTRE OF SEVILLE, NEAR THE CATHEDRAL, LA GIRALDA AND CITY HALL. FREE WIFI AND LAPTOP IN ALL ROOMS The Hotel is an ancient palace from XVI Century perfectly mixed with the highest technology and decoration. Also have two traditional courtyards to enjoy the quietness and natural light of Seville. The Petit Palace Santa Cruz is located in the Jewish Quarter, famous for its charm and small winding streets and close by the typical tapas bars and restaurants and the best shopping area in the city. Seville, situated on the banks of the Guadalquivir River, is famous for its Easter Week processions, April Fair, flamenco, bullfights, great nightlife and landmarks such as the Cathedral and the Giralda. The hotel offers the following FREE services: - Laptop in all rooms- WIFI connection in all rooms and communal zones.- Daily Press- Safety boxes (with capacity for a laptop)- Hydro-massage showers or bathtub in all rooms.- Information on local excursions, city maps, reservations for shows and restaurants.- Two internet points for public use.- Free bike rent (on availability)- Luggage room.- Cots and buggies for kids on request- Complementary bedding and food bowls for your pet- XXL rooms and King size beds on request. - Flat screen TV with TDT- Disabled facilities. - Openbar (coffee, tea, juices and mineral water) More information:- City centre, next to “El Corte Inglés” department store.- Public parking next to the hotel.- Show room for small meetings. The rooms are comfortable, functional and modern and adaptable to all your needs. The hotel is without a doubt, one of the best in its range from which to discover and enjoy Seville, whatever the intention for your trip may be; if you are travelling for business you will not find a better area connected by means of public transport. If you are travelling with children we can offer you are special “Family Rooms” with free cots available. If you are travelling with your pet, we will provide bedding and feeding bowls ( contact the hotel for special conditions regarding pets). You can also take advantage of our free bike rent, exclusively available for hotel guests.Our professional staff will be more than happy to help and advise you on the best restaurants, shopping, places of interest and whatever other necessity you may have.
